allow:
Bash(# Create placeholder PNG files using ImageMagick convert or a simple method
for size in 32x32 128x128 128x128@2x; do
  if [[ ""$size"" == *""@2x""* ]]; then
    # For @2x, use 256x256
    echo ""Creating 256x256 icon as $size.png""
    # Create a simple colored square using base64 encoded PNG
    echo ""iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAYAAAAfFcSJAAAADUlEQVR42mP8/5+hHgAHggJ/PchI7wAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="" | base64 -d > ""src-tauri/icons/$size.png""
  else
    # For regular sizes
    dimensions=""${size%x*}""
    echo ""Creating $size icon""
    echo ""iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAYAAAAfFcSJAAAADUlEQVR42mP8/5+hHgAHggJ/PchI7wAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="" | base64 -d > ""src-tauri/icons/$size.png""
  fi
done

# Create ICO file (Windows)
echo ""Creating icon.ico""
echo ""iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAYAAAAfFcSJAAAADUlEQVR42mP8/5+hHgAHggJ/PchI7wAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="" | base64 -d > src-tauri/icons/icon.ico

# Create ICNS file (macOS) - just use same PNG data for now
echo ""Creating icon.icns""
echo ""iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAYAAAAfFcSJAAAADUlEQVR42mP8/5+hHgAHggJ/PchI7wAAAABJRU5ErkJggg=="" | base64 -d > src-tauri/icons/icon.icns

ls -la src-tauri/icons/)
